media:group.media:title: The Evolution of the Monkey
media:group.media:description:
Visit https://brilliant.org/AnimalOrigins/  to get started learning STEM for free, and the first 200 people will get 20% off their annual premium subscription.

Monkeys are some of the most varied and diverse mammals alive today. Known for their oftentimes arboreal lifestyle and playful nature, these creatures have a long and fascinating history in the fossil record. In today’s video we’ll be exploring that history in detail.

Sources:
https://pediaa.com/what-is-the-difference-between-strepsirhines-and-haplorhines/
https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2011/08/110815162427.htm#:~:text=But%20they%20are%20not%20just,to%20prepare%20for%20the%20next (nails for primates 55 million years ago)
https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.aba1135 (rafting)
https://www2.palomar.edu/anthro/earlyprimates/early_2.htm#:~:text=New%20World%20monkeys%20appeared%20for,clumps%20of%20vegetation%20and%20soil.
https://www.nature.com/scitable/knowledge/library/new-world-monkeys-148121150/
https://www.nationalgeographic.com/science/article/when-monkeys-surfed-to-south-america?loggedin=true

Twitter: https://mobile.twitter.com/AnimalOrigins
